page.title: 02Introduction Part 2
page.content: {Kirkton of Auchterhouse}is the village that grew up around the{church}or{kirk and is about six hundred and fifty feet above sea-level. The present school is the fourth school standing in the village. At the northern end of the village is the{War Memorial.} Joined to it is a drinking trough for horses but no longer used of course. Next to the War Memorial is an old{ {Wishing Well}which is still running. Nearby is an old{lion's head pump}that is no longer in use. There are ninety-six houses in our area including the village and most are owner-occupied. Many of the old farm cottages have been modernised and extended. In addition we have the whole of one large farm, one small farm and parts of two others. To the north the slopes of the{Sidlaws}rise to 1400 feet.
